definition: to follow suit/to imitate sb's example

sentences.english: If the parents watch too much TV, the kids will probably follow suit.
sentences.chinese: 如果父母电视看多了，孩子也会学样的。

sentences.english: They are not afraid to mimic, even if they get it wrong.
sentences.chinese: 他们不怕有样学样，就算犯错也无所谓。

sentences.english: Those who never studying in our campus has been kicked out.
sentences.chinese: 那些在我们学样从来不学习的孩子被开除了。

sentences.english: I hate the man who has no personality.
sentences.chinese: 有样学样，我不喜欢，完全否定，不遗余力。

sentences.english: They learn best by example, and should be provided with models of behavior.
sentences.chinese: 他们学样学得最好，应该给他们提供行为的榜样。

sentences.english: To see a lamb at school.

definition: lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
odd expression/funny looks/queer face/to grimace/to give sb funny looks/to pull faces
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
arrogant appearance/smug appearance/to act condescending/to put on airs
to comply in order to please others/to accommodate sb else's taste/to make fun of
